honors.h1: Leslie H. Cochran University Scholarship (full ride) at YSU
honors.h2: Opportunity Funding Participants 2016 at USEF Nepal

section_1.content: Hello! I am Bikash. I am a technology enthusiast who loves problem solving, software development, and data analysis. At my current university, I have done projects related to web development, math modeling, and research on big data with neural network. I am constantly learning about the state-of-the-art technologies and am ready to implement my skills in the real world.

project1.title: Group AffinityÂ and Fashion Sense
project1.subtitle: SCUDEM Math Modeling Contest, Slippery Rock University
project1.content: Secured first position in tri-universities math modeling contest; Collaborated in a group of three; Researched, designed, and presented a mathematical model using differential equations to illustrate how the information flows and interacts within the different groups of society.

project2.title: Secure and Private AI with Deep Learning
project2.subtitle: Online study scholarship from Facebook & Udacity
project2.content: Participated in 3 months long online scholarship program with Facebook and Udacity on the theoretical and mathematical background behind Deep Learning, Differential Privacy, & Encrypted Deep Learning (taught by Andrew Trask); Worked on the MNIST datasets' classification problem using neural networks with the python libraries PyTorch and PySyft.

project3.title: Deep Learning & NLP
project3.subtitle: Research | YSU Department of CSIS
project3.content: Research in a group of 3 alongside professor Dr. Alina Lazar of YSU on multi-level text classification on stack-overflow data (tag prediction); Used multi-layered neural networks and word embeddings to predict the tags of stack-overflow questions; Achieved 88% of accuracy; Methods/Technologies: Python, NLTK, openpyxl, fasttext.

project4.title: Youngstown Snow Plow
project4.subtitle: PIC Math Research with the city of Youngstown and YSU
project4.content: Successfully collaborated with the city of Youngstown in a team of 5 students to improve the snow-plowing road networks of the Youngstown using the ArcGIS software and the Youngstown's geo datasets. (Support for this Mathematical Association of America (MAA) program was provided by the National Science Foundation (NSF grant DMS-1722275) and the National Security Agency (NSA))

work1.title: Tech Support Intern
work1.subtitle: Turning Technologies LLC, Youngstown, OH
work1.content: Worked with the Tech Support team on resolving the client's technical issues; Analyzed, resolved, and documented the multiple issues of the polling system softwares and tools developed by the company.

work2.title: Student Office Assistant
work2.subtitle: YSU International Center
work2.content: Professionally help the visitors of International center at YSU; Run the clerical tasks such as receiving phone calls, filing documents & communicating with the prospective international students from all around the world.

work3.title: President
work3.subtitle: Nepalese Student Association of YSU
work3.content: Planned & Organized cultural events at YSU such as Dashain & Festival of Color (first time at YSU), which were attended by 400+ participants (students and the community combined).
